channel.title: Will Hanley | Historical International Legal Computational
channel.description: Recent content on Will Hanley | Historical International Legal Computational

item.title: TPD needs a culture of accountability
item.description: Last month, our city police TAC team received training from a man convicted of an atrocity.

item.title: John Thrasher should be Florida State's last politician president
item.description: For a decade, Florida State University has courted the U.S. News rankings with singular focus and remarkable success.

item.title: Egypt's cabinets in Wikidata
item.description: I am a hater of Wikipedia haters. It drives me up the wall when my kids’ history teachers ban them from using it.

item.title: Pashas into Wikidata
item.description: I am experimenting with Wikidata as a research data repository. If I systematically upload various datasets, can I a) make wikidata more global and useful, and b) learn more about my own evidence?

item.title: About
item.description: I am a legal and social historian of the Middle East.

item.title: Appearances
item.description: 2022 2022-02-08 Flordia House Education & Employment Committee - CS/HB 7051 1:33:50

item.title: Why are Israel, UAE, and Bahrain signing agreements and racing the Tour de France?
item.description: It’s the last days of the Tour. UAE, Bahrain, and Israel each sponsor a team.

item.title: FSU must lead on pedestrian safety
item.description: In December 2011, I attended a packed meeting at the Student Union at FSU.

item.title: Documentation, Tutorials, and Teaching
item.description: I continue to learn how to document my own work. If it helps others, great.

item.title: Academic and general writing
item.description: I post my academic work, including downloadable PDFs, in Zenodo’s repositories.

item.title: Datasets to share
item.description: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International License.

item.title: Standalone projects
item.description: I’ve undertaken a few standalone projects. Digital Egyptian Gazette dig-eg-gaz.github.io is the product of an FSU class that I’ve taught five times.

item.title: Charter Circumlocution
item.description: E pluribus unum (out of many, one) has been an American maxim since the late 18th century.

item.title: Back to multirow
item.description: I’ve had to create one more non-RDF version, Ottgaz-data-9. This version reorganizes the data in a way I should have long ago.

item.title: Reconciling place names
item.description: Today I’m archiving (what I hope will be) the final non-RDF version of the Ottoman gazetteer.

item.title: Periodizing the Ottoman Gazetteer
item.description: Change over time is a conceptual challenge in any historical gazetteer.

item.title: Metadata dictionary
item.description: This gazetteer is a transformation of tables in Tahir Sezen’s Osmanlı Yer Adları (Ottoman Place Names), available here and in many other places.

item.title: Transforming the Osmanlı Yer Adları
item.description: The initial data for this gazetteer is a transformed version of Tahir Sezen’s 1996 Osmanlı Yer Adları.

item.title: A Belgian Bombing in Istanbul: How Small States Manage Terrorist Moments
item.description: A century and a decade ago, an Istanbul court sentenced a Belgian named Edouard Joris to death for his part in a bomb attack on the Ottoman sultan.

item.title: History of Nationality
item.description: I wrote a book about nationality, but I have more to say.
